page.title: 17TOURISM AND ELMLEY CASTLE
page.content: The beautiful countryside and villages of thatched cottages and cotswold stone houses and old churches attract many visitors.A number of houses offer bed and breakfast accomodation.Walkers enjoy footpaths and views from Bredon Hill.The forty mile Wychavon Way crosses its eastern flank.There is a 750 year old deer park above Elmley Castle.The castle has been in ruins since the thirteenth century.There is a fifteenth century village cross.There are three public houses; the Plough makes cider,the Queen Elizabeth,named after the 1575 royal visit,the Old Mill Inn,rebuilt in 1972,has a garden and serves food. Little Comberton has two dovecotes (one circular,medieval at Nash's Farm the other at the Manor House.
